column3: Paul Phua trial in US and Macau;LCS scandal;Indian member resigns. ---
Paul Phua's case in the US Federal Bureau of Investigation and Macau: organized crime.
column4: 2008 Royal Malaysia Police report; FBI testimony.
column5: Paul Phua was accused of participating in illegal gambling operations in Macau and the US. He was arrested in Macau shortly after arriving, and then again by the FBI in Vegas. He was also accused of participating in the Premier League 'match-fixing' which he denied. Malaysian Justice Minister Zahid wrote a letter to the US court defending Paul Phua and claiming he was essential to Malaysia's national security. The letter was copied to the lawyer Muhammad Shafee Abdulah.

column3: US Federal Bureau of Investigation trial, Las Vegas trial, Macau Court of First Instance trial.
column5: Phua fought the Vegas case for a year and ultimately emerged practically free of all charges. The prosecutorial ineptitude was a big reason behind this. Phua can only hope that the Macau trial will yield similar results. Lack of evidence hampers the trial.
